sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

Consider the figure given below. Suppose through the mid point R of side OP of a 
parallelogram MNOP , the line NR is drawn intersecting MO at S and MP 
produced in Q . Prove that \(QS = 2NS \).


\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "In triangles NRO and QRP , we have 
\[
	RO = RP 
\]
\[
	\angle \input[s1v1]{}\input[s1v2]{}\input[s1v3]{} = \angle PQR 
\]
\[
	\angle NRO = \angle QRP 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, by angle side angle rule, we can say that these two triangles are congruent.
\[
	\Rightarrow \Delta NRO \cong \Delta QRP 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
So, we can write
\[
	\Rightarrow \input[s3v1]{}\input[s3v2]{} = PQ 
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "$$\text{
Also, we have $\input[s4v1]{} \input[s4v2]{} = NO $}
\[
	\Rightarrow MQ = MP + PQ = NO + NO 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow MQ = \input[s4v3]{} NO 
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
Now, in triangles MQS and ONS , we have 
\[
	\angle \input[s5v1]{} \input[s5v2]{} \input[s5v3]{} = \angle ONS 
\]
\[
	\angle MSQ = \angle OSN 
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, we can write 
\[
	\Delta MQS \sim \Delta ONS 
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
So, now we can write
\[
	\frac{QS }{NS } = \frac{MQ }{NO }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{QS }{NS } = \input[s7v1]{} 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow QS = 2\input[s7v2]{} \input[s7v3]{} 
\]"}, {"id": "s8", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
hence proved.
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["O", "N", "R"], "text": "$$\text{In triangles NRO and QRP , we have 
$RO = RP$, {given}, 
$\angle ONR = \angle PQR${alternate interior angles}, and $\angle NRO = \angle QRP${as they are vertically opposite angles}.}$$
"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": ["N", "O"], "text": "$$\text{Since, corresponding sides of two congruent triangles are equal, therefore, $NO = PQ $}$$"}, {"data": ["M", "P", 2], "text": "$$\text{Since, $ MP = NO${as opposite sides of a parallelogram are equal}, therefore, substituting values, we get $MQ = 2NO $}$$"}, {"data": ["M", "Q", "S"], "text": "$$\text{$\angle MQS = \angle ONS$ {alternate interior angles}, and $\angle MSQ = \angle OSN${vertically opposite angles}}$$ "}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [2, "N", "S"], "text": "$$\text{As the ratio of corresponding sides for similar triangles is equal, therefore, $\frac{QS }{NS } = \frac{MQ }{NO }$, and on further simplification, we get $QS = 2NS $}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
